## **Introduction & Installation**
******************************************

*AllCCS* is a R packge which is used for collision cross section value prediction using machine learning approach.

![](../man/figures/package_workflow.png)

You can install `AllCCS` from [Github](https://github.com/JustinZZW/AllCCS).

```{r,eval=FALSE,warning=FALSE, R.options=""}
# Install `AllCCS` from GitHub
if(!require(devtools)){
install.packages("devtools")
}
devtools::install_github("justinZZW/AllCCS")
```



## Examples

```{r, fig.show='hold'}
library(AllCCS)
# direct predict from smiles 
test_smiles <- c("C=1C=C(C=CC1O)OC2=C(C=C(C=C2I)CC(C(=O)O)N)I", "CCOC1=CC=C(C=C1)NC(CC(C)O)=O", "CN1C=NC=C1CC(C(=O)O)(N)[H]")
test_names <- c('cpd1', 'cpd2', 'cpd3')

result <- CcsPredict(mol_smiles = test_smiles, mol_names = test_names, 
                     base_dir = '.', thread = 2, is_output = 'F')
knitr::kable(head(result, 14))
```

```{r, fig.show='hold'}
library(AllCCS)
# read from csv file
test <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "demo_data.csv", package="AllCCS"), stringsAsFactors = F)
test <- CcsPredict(mol_smiles = test$smiles, mol_names = test$id, thread = 2, base_dir = '.', is_output = F)
```
